intro: Simbuleta orientalis, commonly known as the oriental simbuleta, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Simbuletaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is often found in woodland areas and is valued for its ornamental beauty. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its natural habitat.
